newsitem.title: UK: UK Labour may reveal spending plans in January.
newsitem.headline: UK Labour may reveal spending plans in January.

text.p: Britain's opposition Labour will probably publish its public spending plans in January, finance spokesman Gordon Brown said on Tuesday.

"As it comes to the New Year, probably in January, I will make a speech about what our intentions are, and everybody will know in our election manifesto what our spending commitments are," he said in an interview with BBC radio.
Labour has so far avoided making any specific commitments on public spending or tax.
Brown also said in the interview Labour would not necessarily vote against tax cuts in the budget, due to be delivered at around 1530 GMT.
"We have got to look at it as a whole, but if it is merely returning some of the money that people have lost over the last few years, I would doubt we would want to vote against it," he said.
